item.title: Don’t Trust Your Code—Test It
item.description:
Why Testing Your Code Matters

When we write code, we want it to work. But sometimes, it doesn’t. That’s where testing comes in.

Testing helps us check if our code is doing what we want. It tells us if something is broken, so we can fix it early — before it becomes a big problem.

Why Should We Test?

Let’s say you make a function that adds two numbers. You think it works. But what if it doesn’t? You don’t want to find out later, when everything depends on it.

item.title: The Art of Logging In Python!
item.description:
Logging is a means of tracking events that happen when some software runs. It is an essential aspect of software development that helps in debugging, monitoring, and maintaining applications.

Python provides a built-in logging module that makes it easy to track events and errors in your code

Why Use Logging?

Many beginners use print() statements for debugging, logging provides a better way to record messages, debug issues, and monitor applications.
